questions.subject: Islamic Studies
questions.question: How many Surahs are there in the Holy Quran?
questions.explanation: The Holy Quran contains 114 Surahs (chapters). The longest is Surah Al-Baqarah with 286 verses, and the shortest is Surah Al-Kawthar with 3 verses.

questions.subject: Islamic Studies
questions.question: Who is known as the most authentic collector of Hadith?
questions.explanation: Imam Bukhari is known for compiling Sahih al-Bukhari, considered the most authentic collection of Hadith. He spent 16 years collecting and verifying hadiths.

questions.subject: Islamic Studies
questions.question: In which year did the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) migrate to Madinah?
questions.explanation: The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) migrated from Makkah to Madinah in 622 CE. This event, known as Hijrah, marks the beginning of the Islamic calendar.

questions.subject: Islamic Studies
questions.question: How many pillars of Islam are there?
questions.explanation: There are 5 pillars of Islam: Shahada (faith), Salah (prayer), Zakat (charity), Sawm (fasting), and Hajj (pilgrimage).

questions.subject: Islamic Studies
questions.question: Who was the first Caliph of Islam?
questions.explanation: Hazrat Abu Bakr (RA) was the first Caliph of Islam, serving from 632-634 CE. He was also the closest companion of Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).
